title.narrative: NADO in focus - Enabling NADO to assist the rural civil society

description.narrative: ADDA and NADO have successfully implemented NADO in Focus (NIF) since 2012 in Njombe Region, Tanzania. NIF is ADDA and NADO’s second project together, having implemented a pilot project together in 2009-2011. A total of 60 local facilitators have been trained during Training of Trainers (ToT), establishing a technical resource for the community in the future. 246 Farmer Field Schools (FFS) have been conducted focusing on both food crops and cash crops and 6,371 farmers have been trained, 52% of which are women. A total of 203 Farmer Interest Groups (FIGs) have been established during the project of which 186 are still active, composing 4100 small-scale farmers with 59% women. A SACCOS has been established as part of the project with capital from external donors due to an identification of a need for an institution to facilitate and encourage FIG businesses and investments. An opportunity to access the international market for certified organic produce was identified but after successfully registering 3,265 farmers for organic certification, the process was dropped due to a lack of motivation to continue after the project from NADOs side.
